summary: The Personal Health Investment Today Act of 2025 (PHIT Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals to treat certain expenses related to physical activity, fitness, and exercise as medical care expenses, making them tax-deductible.  It defines qualified sports and fitness expenses, which include membership fees to fitness facilities, participation in physical activities, and equipment costs. It sets a dollar limitation ($1,000 for individuals, $2,000 for joint filers) on the deductible amount and specifies criteria for fitness facilities and equipment. The bill aims to promote health and prevent disease by incentivizing healthy lifestyles.
